runs.comm: in the channel outside Gayle's off stump who, as though playing a Test, shoulders arms
and again Gayle leaves this alone outside the off stump
and again, well - is Gayle quite certain what game he's playing? It's left alone outside the off stump
clunked on the front foot and, at last, West Indies are away. A diving stop at short extra cover parries the ball, and they steal a well-run single
ooh, close, a lovely ball swinging away from Smith who edges, warily, edging the ball to where third slip might've been.
oh and he's absolutely laced this, Smith, climbing into it and hammering it square for four. Bang
cutting away from Gayle who comes forward, attempting to drive, but plays and misses
ooh well bowled - pace and bounce there from Anderson. That spat up on Gayle who thought about pulling but the bounce beat him
and Gayle's on top of this - stepping down the pitch (marching, in fact) to slap him over long-on for four
bowled him! Pitched it up, Anderson, and Gayle stepped outside leg to crack him square of the wicket and inside-edged that into his stumps
and immediately - typically Chanderpaul - he nudges it behind square to get off the mark
and he's been wided - bit unfair, actually, and the crowd roar their disapproval
what a shot. A short-arm pull through midwicket, and he's timed it quite brilliantly
excellent ball from Sidebottom, spearing into the left-hander who punches it to mid-off, but they can't steal a single
loses his line here this time and it's sponged off his pads behind square for a single
poor ball - lost his line again, firing this down the leg side and he whips him powerfully through midwicket for four more
short, wide and uppercut down to Anderson at third man who's underneath it. But no, he hasn't a hope of catching that and it sails over his head for the first six of the day
good comeback from Sidebottom, pitching it up on off stump. Smith, for once, defends
and again, nicely bowled from Sidebottom, Smith just hammering this back to him
that really is outrageous. On, or just outside his off stump, he whips it down to fine leg for another four. Disgracefully inventive
oooh close! Very, very close indeed, Chanderpaul inside-edging it a hair's width away from his off stump
bang: too short from Anderson and Chanderpaul steps outside his off stump, pulling it down to fine leg - lifting it, if you like
and a swing and a miss from Chanderpaul this time. Had he connected with that, the hoardings at extra cover would be reverberating by now
oh that's brilliant from Chanderpaul, but not too smart from Anderson who again pitches it too short, the left-hander premeditatedly steps outside off and again flings it down to fine-leg
and a single! That deserved an exclamation purely for the uniqueness of it, Chanderpaul nudging to leg
and he flicks this in the air, casually - it's ballooning out to Cook at deep square leg who dives but can't quite make the ground
ooh well bowled, pitching it up and it wobbles off the left-hander's pads
clunked on the front foot to mid-on. Ugly stroke, but they grab a single
superb stroke - just so inventive - turning this around the corner for four. Brilliant shot - the third time he's done it this evening
oh that's out, is it? No, but a spoony, fishy shot from Chanderpaul mis-cracking it over Broad's head, and Sidebottom can't quite make the ground. Good comeback from Broad though
clever bowling, dropping it short and a little wider. Chanderpaul tries to crack it square but plays and misses
looped laviciously onto a length, and defended in front of off stump. Good start
whoops, that's much too much width, and chopped down to third man for another boundary
better length, clipped out to midwicket
turned into the leg side again, decent flight and loop
fuller and straighter, turned square
full and right on a length, driven calmly to mid-on and that's an excellent over
too short and straight, shovelled for another boundary via a desperate parry on the edge of the rope
banged in and walloped over the top of Anderson at third man. Smith is just riding this extra bounce in the pitch. Wonderful batting
fuller and straighter, clipped behind square
at least it's only a single this time. Much tighter line
a dot ball! Joy and rapture from the England fielders. Naive bowling, mutter the Sky commentary crew
full and flicked off the pad, another single to complete the over
down the track and driven firmly down to long-on. Good teasing flight from Yardy
a touch shorter and swung into the leg-side, Big intentions, low returns. Spinners rule in Twenty20s. It's official
a hint of width, but Smith misses out with his slash outside off stump. A let-off
speared down the leg-side, and turned away fine. Good variety from Yardy
excellent running between the wickets gets two, as that one is clipped into the deep on the leg-side
not a bad start. Good lift off a decent length, and Chanderpaul nudges that down to third man
swung into the leg-side, big swish from a transformed Chanderpaul, who has unleashed his inner beast since his paint-drying batting in the Tests
big swish into the off side, gets underneath it a touch, but it lands safe
nurdled away to rotate the strike
heaved around the corner by the purposeful blade of Chanderpaul
off stump line, pushed out to complete a tidy debut over
big appeal as Chanderpaul goes down on the sweep, but outside the line
smacked through the leg-side once again, just a modicum too short and there's no stopping that
makes room to steer into the off side, can't beat the fielder though
good response, tighter to the stumps, and a big "ooh" as this one can't be got away from the popping crease
clipped into the leg-side, England will accept this run-rate any day
swished into the leg-side once again. The fielder goes down in a heap, but it's effectively cut off somehow

a maiden international wicket for Mascarenhas, and it's Mr Immoveable himself! Chanderpaul went for the big swing into the leg-side, the shot was on as the ball was short, but Cook dived forward superbly and belied his reputation for ropey fielding with a fine take. Another fine innings comes to an end
pushed out to gully, good line
hint of outswing to the left-hander, pushed away into the off side
clipped square
turned off the hip and a quick sprint for two, the throw comes in from fine leg, but is just a fraction too wide for Prior to pull off the run-out
right in the arc, went back in his crease to free his arms, and that's clobbered
short and wide of the off stump, Samuels clumps it baseball-style over mid-on
full and straight, Samuels pings it straight to mid-off who threatens to throw down the stumps. But doesn't. Excellent ball
outside off, Samuels tries to smack this into The Thames but swings and misses
pinged out to cover on the front foot, and that's well run
bang: there's four. Smith has laced this. A short-arm pull, almost pulling it on the front foot, and it shoots through midwicket for four
good comeback from Anderson here, full and straight and Smith is beaten, the ball wobbling out to cover off his pads. But they steal a single
ohh it's up in the air, Smith trying to smack this over long-on but he's mistimed it and Yardy's running to his left from long-on...he dives forward and takes an excellent catch
what a shot! Absolutely no feet movement - there didn't need to be - and Samuels just slotted him over long-off for six. Pure timing
a slower ball outside the off stump which Samuels pads to cover. Pats, in fact...not pads
another slower ball, he steps back and cracks it off the back foot but can't time it. Cook is quick to skip round the boundary (not really - he sprinted) and save four
cracking ball which takes the outside edge, flying down to third man
an ugly, slower-ball-bouncer which he tries to pull through midwicket, but can't time it. Collingwood is gazelle-like at mid-off and shies at the stumps
an ugly full toss which takes the right-hander by surprise, clumping it around the corner but mistiming it completely
a wide which Samuels tries to sweep, poor ball down the leg-side and really it got what it deserved
fuller this time but again on his legs, he steps further outside the leg stump to time it down the ground
got him this time! Fired down the leg side again by Yardy, Bravo tries to flick him over the top but is beaten by a touch of spin. Prior skips to his right and stumps him slickly and easily
sliding down the leg side, it's sponged to midwicket
another wide - Yardy's trying to bowl straight here but his line is all wrong
a filthy full toss - at least it was on off stump - which is carved behind point
poor ball. Far too short, far too straight, it sat up and was pulled down to fine leg. Clever batting; silly bowling
cracked down the ground for a single
marvellous stroke from Samuels - only slightly short from the bowler, but Samuels stands tall to flick it through midwicket for four
fuller from Mascherenas this time, pushed out to cover by Samuels
too straight, it's cheekily spooned - or lifted, or swept, or something - up and over the wicketkeeper's head
punched down the ground, but not great timing
again a bit too short, crashed off the back foot

ooh great ball, a slower ball which swings into Samuels who is yorked. Prior takes it quite brilliantly, flicking off the bails as he stands up - all in one fluid motion. But has Samuels' foot left the ground? Replays say no.
oh what a shot. He just waited and waited for this, cracking it square for four. A despairing dive from the man at deep point
short, wide of the off stump, it's chipped in the air over point for two
shot of the day! It wasn't even that short outside his off stump but Ramdin just planted his foot, opened the blade and flanged it over point for six
pushed to midwicket

another superb strike from Samuels here, pinging Collingwood straight over his head for six. In fact, it took an age to get over the rope and probably came down with a sprinkling of snow on it, such was its height
pushed out to cover, but straight to cover
banged down to Anderson at long-off who again fumbles
ooh well bowled! A yorker, albeit outside his leg stump, which almost knocks the batsman off his feet. Nevertheless he manages to dig it out to fine leg for a cheeky single

that is quite simply massive. Outside his leg stump, Samuels just flicked it - nothing more than a flick over midwicket, over the stands and into the road! That was quite enormous - the timing brilliant
full toss this time which is smacked to mid-on
deft, delicate and delicious batting here from Ramdin, stepping outside leg and paddles it over fine leg for four. This is quite brilliant
marvellous stroke again, back cutting it for four down past third man. The placement, timing both perfect
slapped to a wide long-on to end a riotous over
oh dear, too wide and swinging a little wider - it's rightly wided
slapped down the ground, but there's no timing in that stroke and they only manage two.
short, wide, and he tries to uppercut this over third man for six but misses

ah but he tries it again and well bowled Broad. Again short, again wide and Ramdin falls for the trap, uppercutting it...but straight down to Mascarenhas at third man who shuffled to his right to swallow a simple catch
a yorker this time, well bowled indeed which he digs out to mid-on
short-arm pull, what a shot - he's absolutely nailed that. Or not...it falls just short of deep midwicket
and he's flayed this over long-off for another six. Fantastic shot, and it sails several rows back
full and straight, it's punched down the ground
a touch of swing into Samuels' pads cracks this aerially down to long-on, but he's timed it too well and Mascarenhas jogs to his left, taking a very fine running catch - juggling it as he does so
oh, that's a backyard shot - an ugly, powerful smite over deep midwicket which just evades the fielder
ooh well bowled, a slower ball which he tries to pat down to third man but misses
oh well bowled Sidebottom, a yorker which is nudged around the corner off his pads

he's absolutely hammered this but straight into the non-striker's stumps. The ball ricochets a metre or so from Sidebottom who walks over and lifts out the stumps, one by one. How unlucky can you get?
full but wide, it's pinged out to cover
clobbered down the ground and they run for one, desperately seeking two
goddim! Swinging into Sammy who tries to hit this into France, but completely misses it and loses his off stump
beaten for pace, and a full toss, Prior collects but they scamper through for a single. Prior shies at the stumps, misses; Anderson then tries to kick the non-striker's stumps down and also misses
another full toss, wide of the off stump and he swings and misses
he's flayed this dead straight, and again Morton fires it into the non-striker's stumps and they pick up a single
